docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; Tampa Bay Rays hand Boston Red Sox their ninth straight loss, 6-5; other MLB scores noted.

docs.snippet: Eric Campbell has been a reliable hitter so far for the Mets and could serve in several defensive positions, if necessary....
docs.lead_paragraph: Eric Campbell has been a reliable hitter so far for the Mets and could serve in several defensive positions, if necessary.
docs.abstract: New York Mets rookie infielder Eric Campbell has sent a jolt through the team; in his first nine games, starting off with a game-saving diving catch in left field in his first game, he has batted .350, driven in six runs and hit a home run; Mets have already pegged him as a 'supersub' who potentially can play eight positions

headline.seo: Eric Campbell Develops Into a Versatile Weapon
headline.main: A Met Finds a Place on the Diamond: Everywhere

docs.snippet: In his first 27 1/3 innings this season, the Yankees’ Dellin Betances struck out 47 batters, which translates to 15.5 per nine innings....
docs.lead_paragraph: In his first 27 1/3 innings this season, the Yankees’ Dellin Betances struck out 47 batters, which translates to 15.5 per nine innings.
docs.abstract: Keeping Score; New York Yankees pitcher Dellin Betances has struck out 48 batters in his first 27 and a third innings this season; strikeouts are at an all-time high, but even in the current environment, Betances is in elite company, with a strikeout total that is the highest among major league relievers.

headline.main: Kid Gloves Off, and a Relief Ace Emerges
headline.print_headline: Kid Gloves Off, and a Relief Ace Emerges

docs.snippet: Melky Cabrera, who served a 50-game suspension in 2012 and was frequently hurt in 2013, has led the Blue Jays to a rare spot: first place in the A.L. East....
docs.lead_paragraph: Melky Cabrera, who served a 50-game suspension in 2012 and was frequently hurt in 2013, has led the Blue Jays to a rare spot: first place in the A.L. East.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner Extra bases column observes that Melky Cabrera, who served a 50-game suspension in 2012 after testing positive for elevated testosterone and was frequently hurt in 2013, has led the Toronto Blue Jays to a rare spot, first place in the AL East.

headline.main: The True Cabrera, So the Blue Jays Hope
headline.print_headline: The True Cabrera, So the Blue Jays Hope

docs.snippet: A small group of team owners has reached out to Robert A. Iger, Disney’s chief executive, to gauge his interest in becoming the next baseball commissioner....
docs.lead_paragraph: A small group of team owners has reached out to Robert A. Iger, Disney’s chief executive, to gauge his interest in becoming the next baseball commissioner.
docs.abstract: Analysis; small but influential group of team owners has reached out to Robert A Iger, chief executive of Walt Disney Company, in hopes that he will consider becoming Major League Baseball’s next commissioner; for them, Iger is exactly the type of media-savvy businessman who could tackle what they believe is the game’s biggest challenge: increasing its appeal to younger Americans and international audiences.

docs.snippet: At the plate, Lucas Duda failed three times against the Diamondbacks to cash in with runners on base; on the mound, Zack Wheeler shook off early trouble to pitch ‘a heck of a game.’...
docs.lead_paragraph: At the plate, Lucas Duda failed three times against the Diamondbacks to cash in with runners on base; on the mound, Zack Wheeler shook off early trouble to pitch ‘a heck of a game.’
docs.abstract: Arizona Diamondbacks beat New York Mets, 3-2.

headline.main: Wheeler Shakes Off Early Trouble, but Mets Fall to Arizona
headline.print_headline: With Step Back Comes Step Forward for Mets in a Defeat

docs.abstract: New York Yankees beat Chicago White Sox, 4-3, in 10 innings.
